trans-unit.source: Enables receiving data from a Web service in a workflow.
This class cannot be inherited.

> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] The WebServiceInputActivity corresponds to a Web service method when the containing workflow is deployed as a Web service.
When the workflow Web service is called, the WebServiceInputActivity receives data.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.WebServiceInputActivity"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.WebServiceInputActivity"></xref> class using the name of the activity.
The user-defined name of the activity.
Represents the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref> that targets the ActivitySubscribedProperty property.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.WebServiceInputActivity"></xref> has received input.
To be added.
Defines an event delegate that is executed after the activity receives the expected call from the Web service invocation.
To be added.
Gets or sets the interface type that defines the method that this activity listens on.
The interface type.
Corresponds to the name of the interface that is used as the Web service contract.
To be added.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether receiving data should start the workflow.
Only the first receive in a workflow can have the IsActivating property set to `true`.
If more than one IsActivating is set to `true`, the session is locked on the first request.
This lasts as long as the other receive blocks the workflow; the session is deadlocked.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if receiving data should start the workflow; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Represents the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref> that targets the <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.WebServiceInputActivity.IsActivating*> property.
The <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.WebServiceInputActivity.IsActivating%2A> property should be set to `true` for only the very first <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.WebServiceInputActivity>.
This signals to the workflow runtime that invoking this Web service method from a client starts the execution of the workflow.
The first activity of a workflow definition that is exposed as a Web service is of type <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.WebServiceInputActivity> and sets this property to `true`.
To be added.

Gets or sets the name of the method on the interface specified by the <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.WebServiceInputActivity.InterfaceType*> property that this <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.WebServiceInputActivity"></xref> represents.

The name of the method on the interface specified by the <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.WebServiceInputActivity.InterfaceType*> property that this <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.WebServiceInputActivity"></xref> represents.
Corresponds to a name of one of the methods contained in the interface that is used as the Web service contract.
To be added.
Gets the collection of bindings associated with the input parameters to the method specified in the <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.WebServiceInputActivity.MethodName*> property.
ParameterBindings on a <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.WebServiceInputActivity> are used to bind the inbound parameters to locations in the workflow.
When the <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.WebServiceInputActivity> executes, the bound locations are set to the values of the corresponding inbound parameters.
The collection of properties used as inbound parameters on the method specified by the <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.WebServiceInputActivity.MethodName*> property.
Represents the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref> that targets the <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.WebServiceInputActivity.ParameterBindings*> property.
To be added.
Gets or sets a collection of roles that are valid to send data to the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.WebServiceInputActivity"></xref>.
Security access exceptions are thrown if the Web service receives a request from a non-member of the Roles collection.
The default value is an empty collection, which gives open access to the Web service.

The <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.WorkflowRoleCollection"></xref> that contains the Web service roles that are valid to send data to the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.WebServiceInputActivity"></xref>.
Identifies the valid user roles that are allowed to send messages from the Web service client to the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.WebServiceInputActivity"></xref>.
The two types of supported roles are Active Directory and ASP.NET.
To be added.
Gets the name of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue"></xref> on which the activity is waiting for data to arrive.
The name of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue"></xref> on which the activity is waiting for data to arrive.
Creates the subscription of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.WebServiceInputActivity"></xref> activity to an event.

The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityExecutionContext"></xref> that represents the execution environment of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.WebServiceInputActivity"></xref> activity.
The <xref:System.EventHandler> for the parent event.
Cancels the subscription of a <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref> to an event.

The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityExecutionContext"></xref> that represents the execution environment of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.WebServiceInputActivity"></xref> activity.
The <xref:System.EventHandler> for the parent event.
To be added.
To be added.
Returns the access type for the specified property.
Used at compile time to validate whether the properties are correctly bound to one other.
Without this interface this information is inferred directly from property getter/setters.
An object that implements <xref:System.IServiceProvider> to provide access to design time services if they are required.
The name of the property.
An <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.AccessTypes"></xref> enumeration value that denotes the access level of the property.
Returns the <xref:System.Type> of the specified property.
Used at compile time to validate whether the properties are correctly bound to one other.
An object that implements <xref:System.IServiceProvider> to provide access to design time services if they are required.
The name of the property.
The for the property whose name is passed as the propertyName parameter.
